full_summary:
# **Architectural & Engineering Services - Chancery Expansion of the Embassy of Canada to the State of Qatar**

## **Title and Technical Description**
The Government of Canada, through Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada, invites proposals for the provision of Architectural and Engineering services to support the expansion of the chancery at the Embassy of Canada in Doha, Qatar. 

The selected consultant will be responsible for producing the working drawings, as well as participating in on-site project activities, in accordance with the scope of work outlined in the Request for Proposals (RFP) - Stage 2.

## **Background and Overview**
The Government of Canada aims to expand the chancery at the Embassy of Canada in Doha, Qatar. A Stage 1 Request for Qualification (RQ) was published on Buyandsell.gc.ca on September 08, 2022. The qualified bidders will now receive the Stage 2 RFP, which includes the scope of work for the provision of Architectural and Engineering services.

## **Key Requirements and Conditions**
- The consultant must be capable of providing the required services in both English and French.
- The consultant must demonstrate familiarity with local regulations and building codes.
- The consultant will be responsible for on-site project activities in the State of Qatar.
- The selected consultant must adhere to all terms and conditions outlined in the RFP.

## **Bid Solicitation and Eligibility**
The bid solicitation is open to suppliers who have demonstrated their ability to meet the mandatory requirements for pre-qualification as outlined in RQ 23-221044.

## **Incomplete or Ineligible Submissions**
Canada reserves the right to reject any bid that fails to meet the mandatory requirements for pre-qualification, or if the submission is deemed incomplete.

## **Notice and Supporting Documents**
Interested bidders may review the entire RFP, including all supporting documents, on the Government of Canada's procurement services website, Buyandsell.gc.ca

**Note:** The complete RFP Stage 2 can be found at the link below:

https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/20/7dbc293ad849c02bbfb3623f8820bf6d/npp_23-221044.pdf and in French at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/20/370e3e7ae72b5afb903b3418506d3db4/apm_23-
